hook.text: Hold a plank and nothing moves. Your muscles are working hard, but no joint changes angle.

buildup.text: Isometric contractions generate force without movement. The muscle tenses but stays the same length.

discovery.text: They build strength at the specific angle you hold. A wall sit builds strength mostly at that knee angle.

twist.text: Isometrics are gentle on joints since nothing moves. They're ideal for rehab and injury prevention.

climax.text: They also spike blood pressure more than dynamic exercises. People with hypertension should be cautious.

punchline.text: No movement doesn't mean no work. Isometrics build silent strength.

quiz.question: What is a key limitation of isometric training?
options: It builds strength mainly at the held angle
